segment.source: Migrating from a Previous Version
segment.target: Migrating from a Previous Version

segment.source: Migrating from a Previous Version
segment.target: Migrating from a Previous Version

segment.source: Migrating from a Previous Version
segment.target: Migrating from a Previous Version

segment.source: With App-V 5.0 you can migrate your existing App-V 4.6 infrastructure to the more flexible, integrated, and easier to manage App-V 5.0 infrastructure.
segment.target: With App-V 5.0 you can migrate your existing App-V 4.6 infrastructure to the more flexible, integrated, and easier to manage App-V 5.0 infrastructure.

segment.source: Consider the following sections when you plan your migration strategy:
segment.target: Consider the following sections when you plan your migration strategy:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about the differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0, see the Differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0 section of About App-V 5.0.
segment.target: For more information about the differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0, see the Differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0 section of About App-V 5.0.

segment.source: Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V
segment.target: Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V

segment.source: Use the package converter utility to upgrade virtual application packages created using previous versions of App-V.
segment.target: Use the package converter utility to upgrade virtual application packages created using previous versions of App-V.

segment.source: The package converter uses PowerShell to convert packages and can help automate the process if you have many packages that require conversion.
segment.target: The package converter uses PowerShell to convert packages and can help automate the process if you have many packages that require conversion.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: After you convert an existing package you should test the package prior to deploying the package to ensure the conversion process was successful.
segment.target: After you convert an existing package you should test the package prior to deploying the package to ensure the conversion process was successful.

segment.source: What to know before you convert existing packages
segment.target: What to know before you convert existing packages

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Workaround
segment.target: Workaround

segment.source: Package scripts are not converted.
segment.target: Package scripts are not converted.

segment.source: Test the converted package.
segment.target: Test the converted package.

segment.source: If necessary convert the script.
segment.target: If necessary convert the script.

segment.source: Package registry setting overrides are not converted.
segment.target: Package registry setting overrides are not converted.

segment.source: Test the converted package.
segment.target: Test the converted package.

segment.source: If necessary, re-add registry overrides.
segment.target: If necessary, re-add registry overrides.

segment.source: Virtual packages using DSC are not linked after conversion.
segment.target: Virtual packages using DSC are not linked after conversion.

segment.source: Link the packages using connection groups.
segment.target: Link the packages using connection groups.

segment.source: See Managing Connection Groups.
segment.target: See Managing Connection Groups.

segment.source: Environment variable conflicts are detected during conversion.
segment.target: Environment variable conflicts are detected during conversion.

segment.source: Resolve any conflicts in the associated .osd file.
segment.target: Resolve any conflicts in the associated .osd file.

segment.source: Hard-coded paths are detected during conversion.
segment.target: Hard-coded paths are detected during conversion.

segment.source: Hard-coded paths are difficult to convert correctly.
segment.target: Hard-coded paths are difficult to convert correctly.

segment.source: The package converter will detect and return packages with files that contain hard-coded paths.
segment.target: The package converter will detect and return packages with files that contain hard-coded paths.

segment.source: View the file with the hard-coded path, and determine whether the package requires the file.
segment.target: View the file with the hard-coded path, and determine whether the package requires the file.

segment.source: If so, it is recommended to re-sequence the package.
segment.target: If so, it is recommended to re-sequence the package.

segment.source: When converting a package check for failing files or shortcuts.
segment.target: When converting a package check for failing files or shortcuts.

segment.source: Locate the item in App-V 4.6 package.
segment.target: Locate the item in App-V 4.6 package.

segment.source: It could possibly be hard-coded path.
segment.target: It could possibly be hard-coded path.

segment.source: Convert the path.
segment.target: Convert the path.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It is recommended that you use the App-V 5.0 sequencer for converting critical applications or applications that need to take advantage of features.
segment.target: It is recommended that you use the App-V 5.0 sequencer for converting critical applications or applications that need to take advantage of features.

segment.source: See, How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.0.
segment.target: See, How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.0.

segment.source: If a converted package does not open after you convert it, it is also recommended that you re-sequence the application using the App-V 5.0 sequencer.
segment.target: If a converted package does not open after you convert it, it is also recommended that you re-sequence the application using the App-V 5.0 sequencer.

segment.source: How to Convert a Package Created in a Previous Version of App-V
segment.target: How to Convert a Package Created in a Previous Version of App-V

segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 4.6 and the App-V 5.0 Client on the Same Computer.

segment.target: Sequence and roll out App-V 5.0 packages.

segment.source: As needed, unpublish App-V 4.6 packages.
segment.target: As needed, unpublish App-V 4.6 packages.

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.0.
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.0.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You must be running App-V 4.6 SP3 to use coexistence mode.
segment.target: You must be running App-V 4.6 SP3 to use coexistence mode.

segment.source: Additionally, when you sequence a package, you must configure the Managing Authority setting, which is in the User Configuration is located in the User Configuration section.
segment.target: Additionally, when you sequence a package, you must configure the Managing Authority setting, which is in the User Configuration is located in the User Configuration section.

segment.source: Migrating the App-V 5.0 Server Full Infrastructure
segment.target: Migrating the App-V 5.0 Server Full Infrastructure

segment.source: There is no direct method to upgrade to a full App-V 5.0 infrastructure.
segment.target: There is no direct method to upgrade to a full App-V 5.0 infrastructure.

segment.source: Use the information in the following section for information about upgrading the App-V server.
segment.target: Use the information in the following section for information about upgrading the App-V server.

segment.target: Task

segment.source: See the Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V section of this article.
segment.target: See the Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V section of this article.

segment.source: Additional Migration tasks
segment.target: Additional Migration tasks

segment.source: You can also perform additional migration tasks such as reconfiguring end points as well as opening a package created using a prior version on a computer running the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: You can also perform additional migration tasks such as reconfiguring end points as well as opening a package created using a prior version on a computer running the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: The following links provide more information about performing these tasks.
segment.target: The following links provide more information about performing these tasks.
